intro: Pouzolzia wightii var. wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
